definitions.example: I ate a piece of toast for breakfast.

definitions.definition: A proposed salutation (e.g. to say "cheers") while drinking alcohol.
definitions.example: At the reception, there were many toasts from the well-wishers.

definitions.definition: A person, group, or notable object to which a salutation with alcohol is made; a person or group held in similar esteem.
definitions.example: He was the toast of high society.

definitions.definition: (chiefly US) Something that will be no more; something subject to impending destruction, harm or injury.
definitions.example: If I ever get my hands on the guy that stole my wallet, he’s toast!

definitions.definition: To lightly cook by browning via direct exposure to a fire or other heat source.
definitions.example: We liked to toast marshmallows around the campfire.

definitions.definition: To grill, lightly cook by browning specifically under a grill or in a toaster
definitions.example: Top with cheese and toast under the grill for a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To engage in a salutation and/or accompanying raising of glasses while drinking alcohol in honor of someone or something.
definitions.example: We toasted the happy couple many times over the course of the evening.
I toasted my feet by the fire.

definitions.definition: To perform extemporaneous narrative poem or rap.
